summary: This document details a request for case funding related to an undercover operation involving Alfredo Rodriguez, an attorney representing plaintiffs in a lawsuit against Jeffrey Epstein. It outlines Rodriguez's attempts to sell documents related to the case instead of complying with a federal subpoena.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez is an attorney representing four female plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein. He previously worked for Epstein and attempted to sell documents related to the case instead of complying with a subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the individual being sued by the plaintiffs represented by Alfredo Rodriguez. He is central to the case discussed in the document.

persons.name: Unknown Individual
persons.context: An unnamed individual is referenced as having contacted Alfredo Rodriguez regarding the documents he was attempting to sell.

connections.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was previously employed by Jeffrey Epstein before representing plaintiffs against him.
Alfredo Rodriguez was contacted by an unnamed individual regarding the documents he was attempting to sell.

events.title: Contact Regarding Documents
events.description: In August 2009, Alfredo Rodriguez was contacted about documents related to the civil litigation against Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Attempt to Sell Documents
events.description: On November 3, 2009, Alfredo Rodriguez met with an undercover employee to attempt to sell documents related to the case.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez was an attorney representing four female plaintiffs suing Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez attempted to sell documents related to the case instead of complying with a federal subpoena.
The total cost for obtaining 'show money' for the undercover operation was $275.00.
Rodriguez was previously employed by Epstein.
Rodriguez was warned that demanding money for the documents was illegal.
